hero.content:
Philippines: The 70s nuclear relic that may open at last
bbc.com

Finished in 1986, the Bataan plant in the Philippines has never produced a kilowatt of electricity.
bbc.com

primary.lead: National Food Authority's (NFA) Supply of Rice
primary.title: Philippines Considers 330,000 Tons of Rice Imports to Boost Stockpiles
primary.description: (Bloomberg) -- The Philippines, one of the world’s top rice buyers, plans to import 330,000 metric tons of rice this year to boost an anticipated decline in its stockpiles.

secondary.title: PBBM: Rice supply ‘good,’ DA, NFA working to prevent price increases - Manila Standard
secondary.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Thursday assured the public that the country has ample supply of rice, and his administration is doing its best to control the price of the staple grain.

secondary.title: Marcos: PH rice supply in good shape but NFA buffer stock too low
secondary.description: “Magpa-plano kami kung kailangan mag-import, kung kailangan magpahaba, magparami ng buffer stock sa NFA dahil masyado ng mababa. 'Yun lang ang nakita naming problema, mababa yung buffer stock ng NFA,” Marcos said.

secondary.title: NFA plan to import 330,000 MT rice assailed
secondary.description: Former Department of Agriculture secretary Leonardo Montemayor yesterday branded as illegal the plan of the DA and National Food Authority to import 330,000 metric tons of rice, saying this violates the provision of Republic Act 11203 or the Rice Tariffication Law.

carousel.title: How Filipinos are banding together to help fishers after oil spill
carousel.description: An oil spill has effectively put life on hold in a coastal region of the Philippines. As clean-up stretches on, cooperation is critical to keep fishing communities above water.

carousel.title: Philippines tries to bring back small fish key to rural diet
carousel.description: TANAUAN, Leyte -- The Philippines, a nation made up of thousands of islands, is home to about 1.6 million people who work in fisheries, and the majority of those fishers are small-scale harvesters who collectively catch almost half of the nation’s fish.

carousel.title: Can the Philippine Island of Boracay Beat Overtourism?
carousel.description: Called one of the world’s best islands, the Philippine resort was closed by the government for six months and reopened with a cap on visitors. Now, with travelers coming back, will it continue to hold the line?

carousel.title: Inspired by Filipino Design, an Apartment Building Looks Homeward
carousel.description: Modular construction and a tight budget didn’t prevent San Francisco architects from giving this affordable housing project an exuberant look, inside and out.
